page.title: 03SOUTHERLY VIEW FROM SCHOOL
page.content: A tractor has ploughed a corn field and got stuck silent in a ditch. Seagulls squawk,squawk, their feathers beating against the wind. Spindly trees lose leaves in the persistent wind. The wind whistles through the adventure playground. Birds swoop down into the bins, here come the bullying,beggar seagulls pushing the defenceless crows aside. Giant white clouds hover over us, The storm clouds a few minutes away. Twisted leaves rustle and fly, wind chilling the children. Netball players shout,scream for the ball. Crisp packets gripped by the wind and grabbed the hawthorne hedge. The bars by the adventure playground clang together,chiming like a church clock.
